Package javelin.model.world.location.fortification

Class Fortification

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.fortification.Fortification
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Academy, Artificer, Dwelling, Guardian, Haunt, Lodge, MercenariesGuild, Mine, Outpost, Sewers, Shrine, Trove, UniqueLocation, WarLocation
    public abstract class Fortification
extends Location
    A guarded place is a world feature that has a garrison army since the bieggining of the game. This is meant to expand the number of places to be explored, while also offering non-scaled (fixed difficulty) encounters to offset the scaled nature of RandomEncounters and most other game battles.
    See Also:
    Location.garrison, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fortification

        public Fortification​(java.lang.String descriptionknown,
                     java.lang.String descriptionunknown,
                     int minlevel,
                     int maxlevel)
        Generates a guarded location based on a difficulty range. The difficulty here is taken as the level of 4 characters that would be a fair combat to the current garrison. This enables subclasses to use the classic D&D tiers, while avoiding absolute predictability:
        Levels 1-5 (low level)
        Levels 6-10 (medium level)
        Levels 11-15 (high level)
        Levels 16-20 (legendary level)
        Levels 21+ (epic, not yet implemented)
        Parameters:
        minlevel - Minimum difficulty. Will be converted into a proper Upper Krust EL.
        maxlevel - Maximum difficulty. Will be converted into a proper Upper Krust EL.

    • Method Detail

      • generategarrison

        protected void generategarrison​(int minlevel,
                                int maxlevel)
        The default implementation generates a Location.garrison according to the location. Called during construction and responsible for setting targetel.
        Parameters:
        minlevel - See minlevel.
        maxlevel - See maxlevel

      • getel

        public java.lang.Integer getel​(java.lang.Integer attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Called when an Incursion reaches its target (and for selecting targets).
        Overrides:
        getel in class Location
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level... (may pass null to locations which should be "absolute" EL)
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed for places that should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        Actor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int), ChallengeCalculator.calculateel(List)

      • getspoils

        public int getspoils()
        Returns:
        The amount of gold that should be given if this in case of a pillage().

      • getspoils

        public static int getspoils​(java.lang.Integer el)
        Parameters:
        el - Will use an encounter level 1 higher than this.
        Returns:
        See getspoils().

      • pillage

        public void pillage()
        Destroys this place, adding a certain amount of gold to the active Squad. This is mostly allowed as to allow a less strategic gameplay for players who want to just pillage and move on, without using locations for their strategic value.
        See Also:
        getspoils()

      • place

        public void place()
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Adds this actor to the game. Should only be used once in theory.
        Overrides:
        place in class Location
